content.user_title: Create specialized Claude Code agents on-demand
content.value_statement: Building custom agents for specific tasks requires understanding Claude Code's agent schema, Task tool parameters, and prompt engineering patterns. This skill provides guided workflows and comprehensive reference documentation for creating effective specialized agents.
actual_capabilities: Guides users through creating agent definition files with YAML frontmatter
Provides quick and interview workflows for agent creation
Documents complete agent schema including tools, models, and permissions
Covers Task tool parameters for subagent invocation
Includes prompt engineering patterns for effective system prompts
limitations: Does not execute agent creation - only provides guidance and templates
Requires Claude Code to be installed and configured
Does not manage agent deployment or versioning
No built-in agent testing or validation capabilities

use_cases.title: Create code review agents

use_cases.title: Create deployment agents

use_cases.title: Create team-specific agents

prompt_templates.title: Create reviewer agent
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the quick-create workflow to make a security-reviewer agent with Read, Grep, Glob tools, sonnet model, and focus on OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities

prompt_templates.title: Create test runner
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the interview workflow to create a test-runner agent that executes tests, diagnoses failures, and proposes fixes with Edit access

prompt_templates.title: Create researcher
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a tech-researcher agent using WebFetch and WebSearch tools to investigate technologies and provide comparison reports

prompt_templates.title: Create full-stack agent
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a full-stack agent with all tools including MCP integrations for complete feature delivery workflows

output_examples.input: I need to create an agent that reviews pull requests for security issues
output: Purpose: Security-focused PR review with OWASP checklist

best_practices: Start with interview mode to understand agent design principles before using quick mode
Use explicit tool scoping to limit agent capabilities to minimum necessary
Include concrete examples and checklists in agent prompts for consistent behavior
anti_patterns: Avoid creating agents with overly broad tool access
Do not skip defining clear boundaries and DO/DO NOT guidelines
Avoid vague responsibilities - be specific about agent workflow steps

faq.question: What tools does this skill require?
faq.answer: No tools required. This is a documentation-only skill that guides users through creating agent definition files.

faq.question: Can I create agents for any programming language?
faq.answer: Yes. Agent prompts are language-agnostic. You define the agent's purpose, tools, and workflow in markdown.

faq.question: How do I integrate created agents with my project?
faq.answer: Place agent definition files in .claude/agents/ directory for project-level sharing or ~/.claude/agents/ for personal use.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads its own documentation files. It does not access project files, credentials, or make network requests.

faq.question: Why is my agent not being recognized?
faq.answer: Check file location (.claude/agents/), file extension (.md), frontmatter name matches filename, and valid YAML syntax.

faq.question: How does this compare to built-in agents?
faq.answer: Built-in agents (general-purpose, explore, plan) are fixed. Custom agents let you define specific purposes, tools, prompts, and behaviors.
